title: Consumer Safety Complaints and Organizational Learning: Data-Driven Quality Improvement Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical analysis and consumer behavior theory
context.additional_context: Data analysis and discussion-centered education utilizing real industrial case studies

learning_goals: Students can analyze the informational value of consumer safety complaint data and explain its connection to organizational learning processes.
Students can comparatively explain the impact of incremental/radical product design changes on safety complaint resolution.
Students can analyze differences in safety complaint rates by vehicle grade and apply findings to quality control strategies.
Students can identify safety risk factors during new product launches and propose preventive strategies.

resources: Automotive Design Change Case Study Materials
Excel/Google Sheets Template for Comparative Analysis

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
